Message:
As I continued to run,
faint footsteps soon
followed after me.

My hoarse shout sounded almost
like a rusted machine’s wails.

“Take care of yourself
more than you do for me!
Go out and live!”

Once the gears keeping me
together rattled and came apart,
all the words I’d held inside
kept spilling forth.

“Love me more
than you love Mother!
Why can’t you live longer?!
Live and die together with me!”

Then, as if to keep me
from crumbling altogether,
I felt two thin arms
wrap around me.

Unbelievably, that mechanical,
artificially warm voice stirred
a spirit within me that shouldn’t
have existed.

“Why are you saying something
a human would say...?”

Tears kept welling up,
and they wouldn’t stop.

Though my sister always
looked so small and frail,
she now seemed so much
bigger than before.
It was all too much for me.

“Nooo... I don’t want...
I don’t want you to diiiie!”

As I sobbed and heaved,
her small hands kept
gently patting my head.
